Question: At night, a towed vehicle must:

Answers.Answer: have a red light at the back

Question: What does this sign mean?
You can stop or park your vehicle over a fire hydrant if someone stays with the vehicle who can move it.
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
If you can do so safely, you may pass on the left at an intersection if:

Answers.Answer: you have the headlights of your vehicle turned on
the vehicle in front is signalling a left turn
the vehicle in front is signalling a right turn
the vehicle in front is going faster than the speed limit

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
What should you do if your vehicle breaks down on a motorway?

Answers.Answer: Lift up the bonnet and boot of your vehicle
Push your vehicle to the nearest off-ramp

Question: You have a restricted licence. A condition for driving at night without a supervisor is that you MUST NOT drive between:
What should you do if an ambulance comes up behind you, flashing red lights or sounding its siren?

Answers.Answer: Put your vehicle hazard lights on and drive on at the same speed
Slow down, pull over and allow the ambulance to pass
Flash your vehicle headlights to warn oncoming traffic

Question: When a flock of sheep are coming towards you on a country road, what should you do?

Answers.Answer: Sound the horn on your vehicle to move them out the way
Slow down or pull over to the side of the road
Turn on your vehicle hazard lights and drive on
Drive down the centre of the road

Question: What does this sign mean?

Answers.Answer: A rest area is 70 metres ahead
Do not stop for the next 70 metres

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
What must you do if you want to turn right at traffic signals where a green light is showing?

Answers.Answer: Push your way through the vehicles coming towards you
Give way to vehicles coming towards you
Wait until the lights change to red and then turn quickly
Turn at once as the vehicles coming towards you will be stopped

Question: You wish to move your vehicle out of a parking space into the traffic flow. What must you do before you move?

Answers.Answer: Flash your vehicle indicators for 1 second
Signal with your vehicle indicators for at least 3 seconds
Turn on your vehicle parking lights
Use your vehicle brake lights (stop lights)

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
If you have a front tyre blowout, the vehicle will:

Answers.Answer: pull to the side with the blowout
pull away from the side with the blowout

Question: What should you do if you meet animals coming towards you on the road?

Answers.Answer: Slow down and move over to the left side of the road
Give a long blast with the horn on your vehicle
Give a lot of short toots with the horn on your vehicle

Question: To tow a trailer on a restricted driver licence, the weight of your vehicle plus the weight of the trailer and its load must not exceed what weight?
Can you stop on a bus stop in a private motor vehicle?

Answers.Answer: Only if it is for less than 5 minutes

Question: Who is responsible for making a child under 14 years use a seat belt or a safety seat in a vehicle?
What is the maximum legal speed limit for a car towing a trailer on the open road?
When traffic is merging, what is a good rule to follow?

Answers.Answer: Speed up to make room behind
Let one vehicle in and then go
Let two vehicles in and then go

Question: Flush medians can be used when:
What does one or more yellow lights flashing at traffic signals mean?

Answers.Answer: Be careful and apply the give way rule
Drive on but increase your speed
Stop until the lights no longer flash
Move to the left-hand side of the road

Question: You may park your vehicle over a fire hydrant if you:

Answers.Answer: leave your keys in your vehicle
have someone stay with the vehicle who can move it
leave a note on the vehicle saying ‘Back soon’
will not be away from the vehicle for more than 5 minutes

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
What must you do when you see 2 red lights flashing outside a fire station?

Answers.Answer: Slow down and drive on carefully if the way is clear
Slow down and stop if any other vehicle is coming
Stop until the lights stop flashing

Question: You are in the left-hand lane at traffic signals. You are waiting to turn left. At which of these traffic signals may you move on?
When should you use the fog lights on your vehicle?

Answers.Answer: When you are in a hurry during the day
When you are coming up to an airport at night
When there is no fog but you want other drivers to see you
When you cannot see because of foggy conditions

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
The 100km/h speed limit sign shown is the minimum speed you are allowed to drive in good conditions.
What is the safest way to drive up to intersections?

Answers.Answer: At such a speed that you can stop if you have to

Question: What does this road marking mean?

Answers.Answer: Vehicles displaying a mobility card may park here
You can park your wheelchair here
Wheelchair parking space for the next 30 metres

Question: When driving on an unlaned road, where should your vehicle be positioned?

Answers.Answer: Anywhere, so long as you can see what is coming
Close to the centre of the road
As close to the left side of the road as possible
